meanings.definition: Just begun and so not fully formed or developed; rudimentary.
meanings.sent1: The inchoate idea needed more time to grow into a complete plan.
meanings.sent2: Her inchoate painting showed promise but lacked detail.
meanings.sent3: The inchoate attempt at baking cookies resulted in a burnt mess.
meanings.sent4: His inchoate understanding of the subject was like a seed waiting to sprout.
meanings.sent5: The inchoate melody played softly in the background, waiting to be composed into a full song.

meanings.definition: In an initial or early stage; just begun.
meanings.sent1: The project was inchoate, with much work still to be done.
meanings.sent2: She inchoate began her journey, unsure of what lay ahead.
meanings.sent3: The inchoate idea popped into his head at the most unexpected moment.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was inchoate, like a spark waiting to ignite.
meanings.sent5: The inchoate morning sun peeked over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
